Instruction: Stir together cocoa and boiling water in a small bowl. Let the mixture cool for 5 minutes while you preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and grease the cookie sheets.

Cream 1/2 cup of shortening and white sugar together in a medium bowl. Add the eggs one at a time, then mix in the vanilla extract and the cocoa mixture. In a separate bowl, combine 2 2/3 cups of flour with baking powder, baking soda, and salt; alternate stirring this mixture into the sugar mixture with the buttermilk. Use rounded tablespoons to drop the cookie dough onto the prepared cookie sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm. To prepare the filling: In a small saucepan, combine the remaining flour and a pinch of salt. Gradually whisk in the milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened, about 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and chill. In a medium bowl, beat together 3/4 cup of shortening and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy. Gradually incorporate the vanilla and the chilled milk mixture, beating until fluffy. Spread filling between cookies.
